articles.headline: China’s Economy Puts New Pressure on Its Lopsided Job Market
articles.snippet: With its uneven pockets of supply and demand and decline in agriculture jobs, China’s huge manufacturing sector is showing new signs of stress.
articles.abstract: With its uneven pockets of supply and demand and decline in agriculture jobs, China’s huge manufacturing sector is showing new signs of stress.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — Wang Junping worked as a farmer in his native Hebei Province and as a coal miner in Inner Mongolia. But on a recent afternoon, Mr. Wang, 49, smartly dressed in a suit jacket, was awaiting lessons at an employment agency on the proper way to use a broom and mop to clean Beijing’s sprawling subway system.

articles.headline: Trader Arrested in Manipulation That Contributed to 2010 ‘Flash Crash’
articles.snippet: Prosecutors said Navinder Singh Sarao manipulated futures contracts in a way that helped prompt the Dow to plunge 600 points in May 2010.
articles.abstract: Prosecutors said Navinder Singh Sarao manipulated futures contracts in a way that helped prompt the Dow to plunge 600 points in May 2010.
articles.lead_paragraph: Five years ago, the global financial system was rocked by the “flash crash,” 15 minutes of chaos that shook the world’s biggest markets and prompted investors both big and small to question how such a vital part of the economy could be brought to its knees.
articles.byline: By Nathaniel Popper and Jenny Anderson

articles.headline: Saudis Announce Halt to Yemen Bombing Campaign
articles.snippet: The Saudi Defense Ministry said the objectives in its bombing of Yemen’s Iran-backed Houthi rebels, which threatened to ignite a broader regional conflict, had been achieved.
articles.abstract: The Saudi Defense Ministry said the objectives in its bombing of Yemen’s Iran-backed Houthi rebels, which threatened to ignite a broader regional conflict, had been achieved.
articles.lead_paragraph: OBOCK, Djibouti — Saudi Arabia said Tuesday that it was halting a nearly month-old bombing campaign against a rebel group in neighboring Yemen that has touched off a devastating humanitarian crisis and threatened to ignite a broader regional conflict.
articles.byline: By Kareem Fahim and Mark Mazzetti

articles.headline: Big Mac Test Shows Job Market Is Not Working to Distribute Wealth
articles.snippet: If the job market cannot keep hardworking people out of poverty and spread prosperity more broadly, how will those tasks be done?
articles.abstract: If the job market cannot keep hardworking people out of poverty and spread prosperity more broadly, how will those tasks be done?
articles.lead_paragraph: Some 15 years ago, searching for a consistent way to compare wages of equivalent workers across the world, Orley Ashenfelter, an economics professor at Princeton University, came upon McDonald’s.

articles.headline: Comcast’s Track Record in Past Deals May Be Hitch for Merger With Time Warner Cable
articles.snippet: Comcast’s record of compliance is now in the spotlight as regulators, and senators like Al Franken, scrutinize its proposed takeover of Time Warner Cable.
articles.abstract: Comcast’s record of compliance is now in the spotlight as regulators, and senators like Al Franken, scrutinize its proposed takeover of Time Warner Cable.
articles.lead_paragraph: In July 2013, executives from the three companies that co-owned Hulu — Comcast, 21st Century Fox and Walt Disney — had a conversation about their joint venture. Hulu, the video streaming service, had been on the auction block, and lucrative bids had come in from two Comcast rivals, AT&T and the satellite operator DirecTV, among other potential buyers.

articles.headline: Atomic Labs Across the U.S. Race to Stop Iran
articles.snippet: A classified replica of Iran’s nuclear facilities in Tennessee is but one part of an extensive crash program within nine U.S. atomic laboratories to block Tehran’s nuclear progress.
articles.abstract: A classified replica of Iran’s nuclear facilities in Tennessee is but one part of an extensive crash program within nine U.S. atomic laboratories to block Tehran’s nuclear progress.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When diplomats at the Iran talks in Switzerland pummeled Department of Energy scientists with difficult technical questions — like how to keep Iran’s nuclear plants open but ensure that the country was still a year away from building a bomb — the scientists at times turned to a secret replica of Iran’s nuclear facilities built deep in the forests of Tennessee.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger and William J. Broad

articles.headline: For Blue Bell, a Drastic Move to Recall Ice Cream as Listeria Findings Rose
articles.snippet: In a rare move, Blue Bell recalled all its ice cream and other products after a succession of smaller recalls failed.
articles.abstract: In a rare move, Blue Bell recalled all its ice cream and other products after a succession of smaller recalls failed.
articles.lead_paragraph: The alert hit HEB Grocery in San Antonio late Monday: Blue Bell Creameries, a Southwestern favorite and the country’s third-largest ice cream brand, was recalling all its frozen desserts over concerns of contamination by the potentially deadly bacteria listeria.
articles.byline: By Rachel Abrams and Hiroko Tabuchi

articles.headline: Freddie Gray in Baltimore: Another City, Another Death in the Public Eye
articles.snippet: A city in which both the mayor and the police commissioner are black will be compared with white-governed cities in how it handles the death of Mr. Gray, who was restrained by the police.
articles.abstract: A city in which both the mayor and the police commissioner are black will be compared with white-governed cities in how it handles the death of Mr. Gray, who was restrained by the police.
articles.lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE — In life, friends say, Freddie Gray was an easygoing, slender young man who liked girls and partying here in Sandtown, a section of west Baltimore pocked by boarded-up rowhouses and known to the police for drug dealing and crime.
articles.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Ron Nixon

articles.headline: Ted Cruz Showed Eloquence, and Limits, as Debater at Princeton
articles.snippet: During his college years, Mr. Cruz was known as a formidable orator who could occasionally be tripped up by his rivals’ humor.
articles.abstract: During his college years, Mr. Cruz was known as a formidable orator who could occasionally be tripped up by his rivals’ humor.
articles.lead_paragraph: PRINCETON, N.J. — By the time he was a senior at Princeton University in 1992, Ted Cruz had developed an arsenal of rhetorical skills and theatrical gestures that made him one of the most polished performers on the college debate circuit. So when he reached the quarterfinals of the national championships at M.I.T., with the title that had eluded him so far now in sight, he decided to try to knock his Harvard opponents off balance with one of his favorite tricks.

articles.headline: Saudi Resolve on Yemen Reflects Limits of U.S. Strategy
articles.snippet: An aerial operation by Saudi-led forces in Taiz, combined with reports of continued fighting, dampened hopes for a broad cease-fire.
articles.abstract: An aerial operation by Saudi-led forces in Taiz, combined with reports of continued fighting, dampened hopes for a broad cease-fire.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Saudi Arabia’s resumption of airstrikes against Houthi rebels in Yemen on Wednesday, only hours after it abruptly declared a halt to most military operations, reflected the difficulty of finding a political solution to the crisis. It also showed the challenges facing the Obama administration as it increasingly relies on allies in the Middle East.
articles.byline: By Eric Schmitt and Michael R. Gordon

articles.headline: An Online Tune-Up for the Used-Car Marketplace
articles.snippet: Beepi, which acts as a broker between sellers and buyers of used automobiles, could alter the way people buy used cars.
articles.abstract: Beepi, which acts as a broker between sellers and buyers of used automobiles, could alter the way people buy used cars.
articles.lead_paragraph: Linda Lo tried shopping for a car in the usual way, and like everyone else, she hated it.
